com.paulsena

Class WordCount

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paulsena.WordCount

  • public class WordCount
extends Object
    Apache Spark Word Counter Counts all occurrences of words from multiple books using Map Filter Reduce techniques. Ability to run multiple instances of class and save/load word counts between program runs. Requires Java 8 since it makes heavy use of Lamba expressions, making the Functional-esq code a lot easier to read. Also makes use of Java 8's Streams, and multiple exception catching features.
    Since:
    2015-07-24
    Author:
    Paul Senatillaka

    • Constructor Detail

      • WordCount

        public WordCount()

    • Method Detail

      • countWords

        public void countWords(String bookTitle,
                       String bookFile)
        Count all words in a given book in preparation for later querying.
        Parameters:
        bookTitle - The title of the book. Must be a non-empty String.
        bookFile - Path to the text file of the book. Must not be null.

      • topTenWords

        public Map<String,Integer> topTenWords()
        Provides the top ten most common words found cumulatively across all books that have been processed by the service.
        Returns:
        A mapping of at most ten words to their respective counts. Never null, but possibly empty.

      • topTenWords

        public Map<String,Integer> topTenWords(String bookTitle)
        Provides the top ten most common words found in a book that was already processed by the service.
        Parameters:
        bookTitle - The title of the book. Must be a non-empty String.
        Returns:
        A mapping of at most ten words to their respective counts. Never null, but possibly empty.

      • saveCounts

        public boolean saveCounts(String fileName)
        Saves the current count of all words that have been processed. Use this in between program runs to keep history of counts.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Filename of the cache file. Can't be empty.
        Returns:
        Boolean of if the save operation worked.

      • loadCounts

        public boolean loadCounts(String fileName)
        Loads count of all words that have been processed. Replaces current counts in memory, so use before processing. Use this in between program runs to keep history of counts.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Filename of the cache file. Can't be empty.
        Returns:
        Boolean of if the save operation worked.

      • logCounts

        public void logCounts()
        Helper function to log current counts of all processed words.

      • logMap

        public void logMap(Map<String,Integer> map)
        Helper function to log current counts passed in Map.
        Parameters:
        map - Map object to log

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
        Destructor method to ensure that the Apache Spark context is stopped when the GC destroys instances of this class. There can only be one Spark context running on the JVM at a time.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
